result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Watson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Anthony Watson.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Discovery and offer received.  Defendant is in the process of viewing.  Defense is waiting for an update on revocation.  Counsel is in contact with the defendant's revocation counsel.  Defense request another hearing date.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Watson not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant's appearance waived.  The defendant was released on parole and parties are waiting for the results of the revocation.  Defense request an adjourned date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Watson in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Anthony Watson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to the trial court.  
*Please be advised, Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Branch 06, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Watson not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing, Attorney Johnson in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Holland Reed for Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Watson not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson recently appointed.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Watson not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant not produced.  SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. State requests an Order to Show cause hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br. 15.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with IND

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Watson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Anthony Watson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Watson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Watson
Current: 947 N 24th Street Apt 5, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 2520 North 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
